ext_description.p: An Array_placement_group is a type of that is a group of placed in an linear or rectangular regular pattern in the assembly. An Array_placement_group may be a , a or aa . The position tolerance specification of an that is included in an array is different from an that is randomly placed. Text support in this part of ISO 10303 is limited to a linear pattern defined by the character to character spacing defined in the font definition. Spacing properties for items other than text is supported by appling Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing methods.
ext_description.note: This part of ISO 10303 provides support for multi-line messages with one instance of the for each line of the multi-line message.
ext_description.example: Examples of components placed as arrays include: test points, thermal vias, integrated circuit memory devices, light emitting diodes, spare land areas, component terminal mating features where the component itself has terminals arranged in a grid, and text.

ext_description.p: An Assembly_group_component is a type of . An Assembly_group_component may be either one or both of an or an . Each component that is part of a group is in the same design view as that group. When this application object is a or a , the placement of the related components will be defined by the placement of this application object.

ext_description.example: This application object is provided to support, for instance, the hardware items required for power device mounting.
ext_description.note: This application object is not included to support process plans.

The intent is for all members of that are also in the role of related_views for to be placed as a group in a placement activity using a CAD tool. However, each member of the group is placed individually in this standard. A receiving system should treat the relative placement of members of the group as derived data. Note that the exception to this is the and where there is no separate placement information for the group members.
